title: Thunderbird 115 and window title: click-border-to-raise is broken
content:
My Thunderbird just got updated to v. 115, I'm on Ubuntu 20.04 with KDE/Plasma 5.18. I have two questions, one of which is possibly a bug.

1. The new layout places a lot of buttons in the window title. How do I remove them? I'd like a standard window title like most of the other app (say, Okular) have.

2. My window manager works with focus-follows-mouse, and a window is raised whenever I click on the window borders or title. With Thunderbird 115 that doesn't work anymore: if the Thunderbird window is partly below some other window, and I click on its borders or title, it is *not* raised. How to fix this? Should I report a bug?

Cheers!

title: 115 Update: Unified folders are all confused
content:
Unified folders got confused after 115 update. I have several problems with folders from several mailboxes not showing in their respective category. For example, inbox that doesn't show in "inbox" category, Junk folder not in "junk" category, and so on. I think all of them are caused by thunderbird not being able to recognize the kind of each folder in different mailboxes, because of different providers and their settings. I have accounts in major providers such as Google and Yahoo, but also have several independent (i.e. business or work) accounts. One of the most striking example of this trouble is one university account that has all it's folders (sent, junk etc) organized under it's inbox. This was showing ok in the previous versions (junk was "junk" category) but now I get all folders (as subfolders) in the "inbox" category, under the account's name.

I attach screenshot from unified inbox. Note that the inbox from one account is missing and in another account all folders are under inbox.

title: Feedback on version 115
content:
Is there a better place than this to give feedback on version 115 of Thunderbird?

In case this is a suitable place, here's what I think after using version 115 for about 1 day.

1. Too many keystrokes to go from folders list to messages list and back. (I expect I'll get used to this after a while.)

2. Thunderbird does not show where my unread messages are. Right now it is showing that I have 9 unread messages in my inbox or subfolders. When I expand the first level of subfolders, it shows me the locations of only three of those messages. I suppose the other 6 are in sub-subfolders and beyond but I can't see where. Maybe I could expand the entire folder tree but I don't want to do that because I have about 173 folders. (I can't imagine getting used to this one.)

I've been very happy with Thunderbird since I migrated from Eudora (because at that time Eudora didn't handle non-Latin characters well) but I can't recommend Thunderbird to anyone in its current state.

title: Missing feature in Moving Email to a folder
content:
Folks,

In the older versions of TB 102 and earlier, MOVING a bunch of email to a folder was much easier. Move To folder pop-up allows the name of the folder to be moved to by typing in the search box.

This supernova version made is so inconvenient to move email, as now one cannot type the email folder to move to, itstead one must use a LONG-Winded method to move email by only selecting the folder in the pop-up.

Please BRING that option of typing the name of the folder for the email to be moved to. It is so much more convenient. Otherwise what is the point of reducing the value of such features?

Even the file menu is placed in the wrong position, it SHOULD be at the top and then underneath the File menu, you can have the mail space toolbar.

Can you consider these two things urgently? Thanks.

title: Thunderbird new Version 115.2.2 does not receive any hotmail emails any more
content:
Thunderbird has recently updated itself to 115.2.2, ever since than it ist not able anymore to integrate my hotmail emails.

Every time I push the "get new messages button" in thunderbird a new (quite big, but empty) pop up window appears for a split second before it disappears again. No Emails from hotmail are loaded by the way. It kind of looks like it might try to connect to hotmail with this pop up, but this is just a guess. Before 115.2.2 thre was no such pop up windows. Fact is I'm missing all my hotmail Emails in the Inbox and they will not load.

I also discovered that each time for this split second pop up thre is also an entry in the error log, which reads: 12:08:50.905 uncaught exception: 2147500036.

BR 

  Wolfgang

title: Issues with Lightning since TB 115
content:
Since TB 115, I have issues with the "invite" functionality of Lightning, as follows.

It generates errors as follows:

  • "invite" does not work. I can add emails to be invited to an event, but the invite is then not sent at least with the option "notify" + "send individual mail" (other alternatives such as open visible list of destinatories are not feasible due to privacy)
  • when opening an "event" from the calendar, it displays in a full-screen format (see screenshot_2) that lists all invited attendees
  • The "invite attendees" window works but has a strange pink block on top right (see screenshot_3)
  • the page where the format of sending ("notify", "send individual mails") is not accessible any more

Currently the calendar as such works fine. But the "invite" function is critical for the use I am giving as transnational NGO to invite to meetings etc. All worked fine with previous TB versions.

System config: WIN10 prof, all updates installed, fully licensed, AMD Ryzen 9 5900X etc. (mid-end system built in 2022).

Thanks for looking into a solution.

Klaus

title: Reply to all sometimes confuses email adresses
content:
I have a work e-mail account (IMAP) that works just fine. But sometimes when I recieve an email and I reply to all and thunderbird confuses all the addresses. Even though thunderbird displays a warning saying that the sending address desn't match the replier sometimes it has got me in some trouble because i sent some mails like it was from another email.

I have noticed that this problem happens when I'm in CC and there's only one user in the "to" box. I send you a couple of pictures that explains it better.

In red is the original sender in green is the "to" reciever in blue is me, in CC

When I put reply to all, the sender appears like the main reciever "to" (red), the original reciever appears like the sender (green). And I appear in CC. As you can see, the yellow warning appears, but is a mistake
creator: gustavobarbaran

title: E-mail notification alert not appearing
content: Many people have reported this problem. I have done a new installation from scratch of Thunderbird 102.5.0 (64-bit). Everything seems to be working except that it does not play a notification sound when new mail arrives. There is an existing article about this at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/991323 I have done everything reported in this article. I have quintuple checked that the option to play a sound is selected, I am using the system default sound, I have gone into about:config and made sure condstore is false, and I still do not get a notification sound after restarting Thunderbird or rebooting the system (Windows). I have also tried the add-on "Mailbox Alert", and it also is not giving me a notification for all mail. (It might be working for one of my "send the message to" local folders.) But I shouldn't have to do this, Thunderbird should work correctly "out of the box". I am using IMAP as the connection method to gmail.com. Thunderbird is always running while the PC is on, in minimized state. One odd thing, though: when I maximize Thunderbird to see if there is any new mail, and I see that there is, I read it. I then minimize the application, and a second or so later the notification DOES play. It doesn't make any sense, and it certainly does not do any good, for the notification to play AFTER reading new mail. So: does anyone have any new information on fixing this problem since the previous fixes were posted? I've done web searches for fixes and have found many articles, and have tried everything everyone has suggested, but there is no fix. I'm willing to try working with Mailbox Alert more, but I'd really prefer the problem to be fixed properly at the source. It also seems to me that this problem has been going on for years, it should have been fixed by now.
creator: mozilla451

Vedle něj byla vlevo ikonka stažení zpráv a vpravo tři vertikální tečky s dalšími možnostmi. Ale: okukoval jsem, klikal, co je kde ještě nového a tuto možnost jsem zčistajasna ztratil. creator: ivo.mraz

title: inaccessibility of internet passwords
content:
I used to understand this stuff, but have now aged out (91) and am totally lost. In the old days, starting with the 3-bar menu symbol, there was a followable path to reach the place where Thunderbird stored the passwords needed to get access to one's ISP accounts. If that still exists, I can't now find it.

I have a new Dell laptop that I am trying to activate. Comcast does not accept the PWs (that I have written down), so I want to find them on this older machine where they still work. Following TB's instructions, the expected "Saved Passwords" box does not appear; instead we get "Saved Logins". "Logins" is apparently a synonym for what I might call "retail" passwords, used to access bank, vendor, &c accounts, but these are distinct from network-access accounts. (In general, I think TB fails to distinguish adequately between the two password categories, but that's another question.)

So the question is: how do I get access to the ISP passwords stored on this old, working, machine, so that I can transfer them to the new one?

title: Thunderbird 115: combine menu and "unified" toolbar?
content:
[Thunderbird 115 on Ubuntu 20.04, KDE/Plasma 5.18]

In my previous version of Thunderbird (possibly 70+?) I had a menu bar (with "File", "Edit", etc) that also included some icons with functions such as "write", "search", and similar, that I used frequently. To be honest I don't remember if this could be achieved simply by "Customize..." or with some add-on.

Now in TB 115 there's a separate menu bar and a "unified" toolbar where those icons have been moved. Is there any way to move those icons & functions back to the menu bar, and remove the unified toolbar? Or vice versa: move the menu in the unified toolbar. It's a pity with the waste of vertical space.

I know that the unified toolbar has a sort of menu ("hamburger menu", the three horizontal bars, on the right), but this menu is not as convenient as the menu bar, which for example has an "Edit" menu, which I don't find in the "hamburger menu".

Cheers!

title: Migrating TB 115.2.2 from/to Win10 Problem, No Response from Mail Server
content:
I have been using this method to transfer my TB pop mail from Win10 to Win10 machine for almost a decade. I would delete C:\Users\"username"\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird then copy to the same location, the same tree from the source machine. Usually when I would click "get mail" it would work first try but the worst would be that I'd have to stop TB and rename Thunderbird directory, (i.e. C:\Users\powell\AppData\Roaming\ThunderbirdX ) Then start TB and enter the pop server data, enter password in the appropriate panel and download new messages, then stop TB, delete the new Thunderbird folder and rename the migrated one into that spot. It worked hundreds of times till about version 102. Now I don't get the login panel from the mail server. No status messages from the bottom of the screen. 

     I still get mail on my original TB installation even on 115.2.2 now but I've tried to move the mail to other machines for two months now and I"m getting nowhere. I have even followed the migration video instructions step by step with no results.  I know that if I just create a new installation it works just fine but I DON'T WANT TO LEAVE MY OLD MAIL BEHIND!    
   I have uploaded two jpegs: My server setup and another of an error message I get with a new installation, a security exception that was never a big deal in the past.  Maybe it still isn't a big deal but I've gotten nowhere.  I hope someone out there knows how to fix this problem or at least troubleshoot it better than I have been!
creator: wcp38

title: Latest version of Thunderbird leaves tabs with open messages blank
content: One user has tabs with open email messages, some of which are no longer in inbox, but moved to other folders. When the latest version of Thunderbird opens, these get replaced with blanks, including no title in the tab. They can be re-opened because many of them have a tag that can be found in the search box, but this is a SERIOUS bug for at least one user. Note that even those messages in the current inbox become blank. This is like a magnified version of the problem when the inbox is compacted. On steroids. A SERIOUS bug that needs to be fixed.

title: Current message highlight "disappears" while navigating messages
content:
In the new Supernova interface, using the keyboard to navigate through messages results in the active highlight disappearing and/or becoming super light. This is a UI problem as I can't see which message I'm on to know when to stop holding down the key.

The attached images are from a screen recording, to try and capture the essence of the problem. You'll see the line highlights exist in various shades. While holding down the up/down key they spend a lot of their time in the very light shade, meaning nothing is visibly selected on the screen.
creator: mortoray
